name: abate
trans: vt. 减少, 减轻；废除; vi. 减少, 失效; n. 人名；阿巴特 时 态: abated, abating, abates

sentences.english: We waited for the storm to abate.
sentences.chinese: 我们等风暴减弱。

detailed_translations.english: to become less strong or decrease

name: abide
trans: vt. 容忍, 忍受; 等候; vi. 逗留, 居住 时 态: abode , abided abiding, abides

sentences.english: I can't abide people with no sense of humour.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌和没有幽默感的人打交道。

sentences.english: You'll have to abide by the rules of the club.
sentences.chinese: 你必须遵守俱乐部的规定。

detailed_translations.english: bear, stand

name: abject
trans: adj. 凄惨的;绝望的; 糟透的，蹩脚的; 卑鄙的，卑劣的; 卑躬屈膝的，奴性的; n. 弃儿; adv. 凄惨地;绝望地；糟透地，蹩脚地; n. 凄惨;绝望；卑鄙，卑劣; n. 凄惨;绝...

sentences.english: an abject apology
sentences.chinese: 低声下气的道歉

detailed_translations.chinese: 卑鄙的；可怜的；不幸的；（境况）凄惨的，绝望的

name: abnormal
trans: adj. 反常的，异常的；变态的副 词: abnormally

sentences.english: abnormal behaviour
sentences.chinese: 反常行为

sentences.english: an abnormal level of cholesterol
sentences.chinese: 胆固醇水平异常

sentences.english: My parents thought it was abnormal for a boy to be interested in ballet.
sentences.chinese: 我父母认为一个男孩子对芭蕾舞感兴趣并不正常。

detailed_translations.english: very different from usual in a way that seems strange, worrying, wrong, or dangerous

name: abolish
trans: vt. 废除, 废止时 态: abolished, abolishing, abolishes 形容词: abolishable 名 词: abolisher 名 ...

sentences.english: Slavery was abolished in the US in the 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 美国于19世纪废除了奴隶制。

detailed_translations.english: to officially end a law, system etc, especially one that has existed for a long time

name: absolute
trans: adj. 绝对的；完全的；专制的; n. 绝对事物；绝对 名 词: absoluteness

sentences.english: I have absolute confidence in her.
sentences.chinese: 我对她充满信心。

sentences.english: Some of the stuff on TV is absolute rubbish.
sentences.chinese: 电视上播放的有些东西简直就是垃圾。

sentences.english: How did you do that? You’re an absolute genius.
sentences.chinese: 你是怎么做的？ 你绝对是个天才。

sentences.english: That meal last night cost an absolute fortune.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚那顿饭花了一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: complete or total

name: absurdity
trans: n. 极端无理性,悖理；荒谬; 谬论；荒谬的行为

name: accentuate
trans: vt. 使突出；强调; 重读，以重音读出; 加重音符号于; 使恶化，使严重 时 态: accentuated, accentuating, accentuates 名 词: ...

sentences.english: The photograph seemed to accentuate his large nose.
sentences.chinese: 照片似乎突出了他的大鼻子。

detailed_translations.english: to make something more noticeable

name: acclaim
trans: vt. 向…欢呼，向…喝彩; 称赞…; 欢呼或拥戴为…; n. 热烈欢迎或赞同；称赞 时 态: acclaimed，acclaiming，acclaims

sentences.english: His work was acclaimed by art critics.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品得到艺术评论家的推崇。

sentences.english: Angela Bassett has won critical acclaim for her excellent performance.
sentences.chinese: 安杰拉·巴西特因她出色的表演而赢得了评论界的赞扬。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone or something publicly
Acclaim is public praise for someone or something

name: acclimatise
trans: vi. & vt. 服水土,适应新气候或环境

sentences.english: This year he has left for St Louis early to acclimatise himself.
sentences.chinese: 今年他早早地前往圣路易斯以便适应新环境。

detailed_translations.chinese: 服水土； 适应新环境

name: accrue
trans: vi. 自然增长或利益增加；产生; vt. 积累；获得 时 态: accrued, accruing, accrues 名 词: accruement

sentences.english: Interest will accrue until payment is made.
sentences.chinese: 利息将会累计增加，直至付清款项。

detailed_translations.chinese: 产生；自然增长或利益增加
detailed_translations.english: if advantages accrue to you, you get those advantages over a period of time

name: accuse
trans: v. 控告；控诉；谴责；归咎于 时 态: accused，accusing，accuses 名 词: accuser 副 词: accusingly

sentences.english: The professor stands accused of (=  has been accused of  ) stealing his student’s ideas and publishing them.
sentences.chinese: 那位教授被指控剽窃学生的观点拿去发表。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you believe someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something bad

name: achievable
trans: adj. 做得成的,可完成的,可有成就的

sentences.english: A 50% market share is achievable.
sentences.chinese: 百分之五十的市场占有率是可实现的。

sentences.english: It is often a good idea to start with smaller, easily achievable goals.
sentences.chinese: 以较小的、容易实现的目标来做开端经常是个好主意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可完成的；可有成就的；做得成的
detailed_translations.english: If you say that something you are trying to do is achievable, you mean that it is possible for you to succeed in doing it

name: acrobatic
trans: adj. 杂技的，杂技般的，杂技演员的

sentences.english: They performed some amazing acrobatic feats.
sentences.chinese: 他们表演了一些令人惊叹的杂技动作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 杂技的； 杂技般的； 杂技演员的
detailed_translations.english: acrobatic movements involve moving your body in a very skilful way, for example by jumping through the air or balancing on a rope

name: adjoin
trans: vi. 毗连，邻接; vt. 毗连，邻接 时 态: adjoined, adjoining, adjoins

sentences.english: A vacant plot of land adjoins his house.
sentences.chinese: 有一块空地紧挨着他家。

detailed_translations.english: to be next to or joined to sth

name: adolescence
trans: n. 青春期

sentences.english: Some young people suddenly become self-conscious and tongue-tied in early adolescence.
sentences.chinese: 一些年青人在青春期早期突然变得害羞结舌。

detailed_translations.english: the time, usually between the ages of 12 and 18, when a young person is developing into an adult

name: adornment
trans: n. 装饰,装饰品

sentences.english: It was a building without any adornment or decoration.
sentences.chinese: 它曾是一栋完全未经装修的大楼。

detailed_translations.english: something that you use to decorate something

name: aeration
trans: n. 通风；充气；曝气

sentences.english: Stale. Lack of bouquet and freshness of a wine through too much aeration or infection with film yeasts.
sentences.chinese: 走味的、沉滞的：由于通风过度或受产膜酵母的侵染，葡萄酒变得缺乏香气及新鲜爽口感。

name: aerobics
trans: n. 有氧健身法,健美操

sentences.english: Water aerobics can be performed just about anywhere; from health and fitness clubs to public or private swimming pools to even shallow lakes.
sentences.chinese: 水中有氧运动没有地方限制，从健康和健身俱乐部，到公共或私人泳池，甚至浅水湖泊，都可以进行；

sentences.english: They not only do it with great workout equipment and well-designed aerobics classes, but with answers to every detail of the working professional's personal needs.
sentences.chinese: 他们不仅有优质的健身器材，精心设计的有氧运动课程，而且对个人专业健身问题和需求也作出详尽的解答。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有氧运动法，增氧健身法
detailed_translations.english: a very active type of physical exercise done to music, usually in a class

name: aeronautical
trans: adj. 航空学的

name: affiliation
trans: n. 联系;从属关系; 附属机构，隶属机构，分公司，分会，分部; 接纳，入会，交往，社会交际关系; 亲和性，群聚性; 亲父鉴定

sentences.english: The kidnappers had no affiliation with any militant group.
sentences.chinese: 这些绑架者与任何军事组织都没有紧密联系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 友好关系；加入；联盟；从属关系
detailed_translations.english: the connection or involvement that someone or something has with a political, religious etc organization

name: afflict
trans: vt. 折磨；使痛苦；使苦恼 时 态: afflicted, afflicting, afflicts 形容词: afflictive

detailed_translations.english: to affect someone or something in an unpleasant way, and make them suffer

name: affluent
trans: adj. 富裕的；丰富的；流畅的; n. 支流；富人 副 词: affluently

sentences.english: affluent families
sentences.chinese: 富裕的家庭

sentences.english: The diet of the affluent has not changed much over the decades.
sentences.chinese: 富人的饮食数十年来没怎么变。

detailed_translations.english: having plenty of money, nice houses, expensive things etc
The affluent are people who are affluent

name: afield
trans: adv. 在战场上；去野外；在远处；远离著

sentences.english: They were exporting as far afield as Alexandria.
sentences.chinese: 他们出口货物远至亚历山德里亚。

sentences.english: students who come from further afield
sentences.chinese: 远方来的学生

detailed_translations.chinese: 在战场上；去野外；在远处；远离著
detailed_translations.english: far away, especially from home

name: aggravate
trans: vt. 使恶化, 使更严重; 激怒, 使恼火 时 态: aggravated, aggravating, aggravates 名 词: aggravator

sentences.english: Their money problems were further aggravated by a rise in interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 由于利率上调，他们的财务问题更加严重。

sentences.english: Building the new road will only aggravate the situation .
sentences.chinese: 建造那条新路只会使情况恶化。

detailed_translations.english: to make a bad situation, an illness, or an injury worse

name: agreeable
trans: adj. 欣然同意的; 令人愉快的, 惬意的 副 词: agreeably

sentences.english: We spent a most agreeable couple of hours.
sentences.chinese: 我们非常愉快地度过了几个小时。

sentences.english: My parents are quite agreeable to my studying abroad.
sentences.chinese: 我父母很同意我去国外留学。

detailed_translations.english: pleasant

name: airy
trans: adj. 空气的；大气的; 空中的；高耸入云的; 通风的，空气新鲜的; 虚幻的；出于空想的; 轻而薄的; 轻快的；优美的; 快活的；欢乐的; 做作的；高傲的; 轻率的 比较级: air...

sentences.english: All the hotel’s bedrooms are light and airy.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店的所有客房都明亮通风。

detailed_translations.chinese: 空气的；通风的；幻想的；轻快的；空中的
detailed_translations.english: an airy room or building has plenty of fresh air because it is large or has a lot of windows

name: align
trans: vt. 使结盟；使成一行；匹配; vi. 排列；排成一行 时 态: aligned also alined aligning alining aligns alines 名 ...

sentences.english: The desks were neatly aligned in rows.
sentences.chinese: 书桌一行行排得整整齐齐。

sentences.english: Make sure that all the holes align.
sentences.chinese: 确保所有的洞眼成一条直线。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange things so that they form a line or are parallel to each other, or to be in a position that forms a line etc

name: alleged
trans: adj. 声称的,所谓的副 词: allegedly

sentences.english: They have begun a hunger strike in protest at the alleged beating.
sentences.chinese: 他们已经开始了绝食以抗议所指称的打人事件。

detailed_translations.chinese: 所谓的；声称的；被断言的
detailed_translations.english: an alleged crime, fact etc is one that someone says has happened or is true, although it has not been proved

detailed_translations.chinese: 宣称（allege的过去式和过去分词）；断言

name: allowance
trans: n. 津贴, 补助, 零用钱时 态: allowanced, allowancing, allowances

sentences.english: Sales staff get a generous mileage allowance or a company car.
sentences.chinese: 销售人员有优厚的里程补贴或者公司提供的专用汽车。

sentences.english: If you are entitled to sickness allowance, you must claim it from your employer.
sentences.chinese: 你如果有资格领取疾病津贴，必须向雇主申请索要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 津贴， 补贴； 零用钱
detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you are given regularly or for a special purpose

name: alpine
trans: adj. 阿尔卑斯山的，高山的 Alpineadj. 阿尔卑斯山的;阿尔卑斯山区居民的; 具有阿尔卑斯山人种特征的; 高山的

sentences.english: breathtaking alpine scenery
sentences.chinese: 令人叹为观止的阿尔卑斯山风景

sentences.english: alpine flowers
sentences.chinese: 高山花卉

sentences.english: alpine skiing
sentences.chinese: 高山滑雪

detailed_translations.chinese: 高山的, 阿尔卑斯山的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the Alps (=  a mountain range in central Europe  ) or to mountains in general

name: altruistic
trans: adj. 利他的,无私心的

sentences.english: Were his motives entirely altruistic?
sentences.chinese: 他的动机是完全无私的吗？

detailed_translations.english: altruistic behaviour shows that you care about and will help other people, even though this brings no advantage for yourself

name: ambassador
trans: n. 大使, 使节形容词: ambassadorial 名 词: ambassadorship

sentences.english: the US ambassador to Spain
sentences.chinese: 美国驻西班牙大使

detailed_translations.english: an important official who represents his or her government in a foreign country

name: amidst
trans: prep. 在…当中

sentences.english: During some trials, an audible tone was played through the headphones, either amidst white noise or on its own, and afterwards the participants were asked if they had noticed it.
sentences.chinese: 在一些测试中，耳机里会播放一些可被听见的声音，该声音或混杂于白噪音中，或单独播放，之后，参与者将被问及是否注意到这些声音。

name: amphibious
trans: adj. 两栖的, 水陆两用的; 两栖作战的; 具有双重性的

sentences.english: amphibious creatures
sentences.chinese: 两栖生物

detailed_translations.chinese: [生物] 两栖的，水陆两用的；具有双重性的
detailed_translations.english: able to live both on land and in water

name: amplifier
trans: n. 扩音器, 放大器; 扩大的人；详述者

sentences.english: We can use them as an amplifier.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以将其当作放大器。

sentences.english: The audio interface must support your amplifier and speaker setup.
sentences.chinese: 音频接口必须支持您的扩音器和扬声器设置。

sentences.english: I was not just one college kid, I was an amplifier for him throughout the whole computer science department.
sentences.chinese: 我不仅是一个大学生，我同时也是那个可以帮他在整个计算机系中发声的扩音器。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of electrical equipment that makes sound louder

name: amplify
trans: vt. 放大, 扩大; 增强; vt. & vi. 详述 时 态: amplified, amplifying, amplifies

sentences.english: an amplified guitar
sentences.chinese: 带有扩音设备的电吉他

detailed_translations.chinese: 放大， 增强； 扩大； 详述， 进一步阐述
detailed_translations.english: to make sound louder, especially musical sound

name: anatomist
trans: n. 解剖学家,剖析者

name: animate
trans: v. 使具活力；使生气勃勃; 把…制作成动画片; adj. 有生命的；有活力的；有生气的 时 态: animated, animating, animates

sentences.english: Laughter animated his face for a moment.
sentences.chinese: 笑容使他的脸上一时增添了生气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使有生气；使活泼；鼓舞；推动
detailed_translations.english: to give life or energy to something
living

name: anniversary
trans: n. 周年纪念

sentences.english: Jack and Kim celebrated their twentieth wedding anniversary in January.
sentences.chinese: 1月，杰克和金庆祝了他们的结婚20周年纪念日。

detailed_translations.english: a date on which something special or important happened in a previous year

name: antenna
trans: n. 天线；触角，触须 Antennan. antenae 触角形容词: antennal

sentences.english: television antennas
sentences.chinese: 电视机天线

detailed_translations.chinese: [电讯] 天线；[动] 触角，[昆] 触须
detailed_translations.english: one of two long thin parts on an insect’s head, that it uses to feel things

name: apace
trans: adv. 急速地；飞快地，迅速地

sentences.english: Expansion of the company has continued apace .
sentences.chinese: 该公司继续迅速扩张。

detailed_translations.english: happening quickly

name: appalling
trans: adj. 骇人听闻的; 极糟的, 很严重的 副 词: appallingly

sentences.english: She suffered appalling injuries.
sentences.chinese: 她伤势非常严重。

sentences.english: He was kept in appalling conditions in prison.
sentences.chinese: 他被关在环境极其恶劣的监狱中。

sentences.english: an appalling famine
sentences.chinese: 骇人听闻的饥荒

detailed_translations.english: very unpleasant and shocking

name: apparatus
trans: n. 运动器械, 器具, 仪器; 机构, 组织; 器官

sentences.english: Astronauts have special breathing apparatus.
sentences.chinese: 航天员有专门的呼吸装装备。

sentences.english: The tax will require a massive administrative apparatus.
sentences.chinese: 税收需要大规模的行政机构。

detailed_translations.chinese: 器械，器具，仪器；机构，组织
detailed_translations.english: the set of tools and machines that you use for a particular scientific, medical, or technical purpose

name: apportion
trans: vt. 分摊, 分配时 态: apportioned, apportioning, apportions

sentences.english: It’s not easy to apportion blame (=  say who deserves to be blamed  ) when a marriage breaks up.
sentences.chinese: 婚姻破裂很难说是谁的错。

detailed_translations.english: to decide how something should be shared among various people

name: apprehensive
trans: adj. 不安的；害怕的；担心的；恐惧的；焦虑的; 善于领会的；敏悟的; 知晓的，有认识力的 副 词: apprehensively

sentences.english: Some had apprehensive looks on their faces.
sentences.chinese: 有些人面带愁容。

detailed_translations.chinese: 忧虑的；不安的；敏悟的；知晓的
detailed_translations.english: worried or nervous about something that you are going to do, or about the future

name: aquarium
trans: n. 养鱼缸, 水族馆复 数: aquaria

sentences.english: We saw a ray at the aquarium.
sentences.chinese: 我们在水族馆看见了一只鳐。

sentences.english: In Amsterdam the girls all stand in the windows shimmering as tantalising as tropical fish beyond the gleam of aquarium glass.
sentences.chinese: 在阿姆斯特丹，姑娘们都站在窗后，光芒四射柔情撩人宛如水族馆玻璃背后脉脉含情的热带鱼。

sentences.english: Recently the bakers created an octopus complete with tentacles and suckers for a charity event held for a local aquarium.
sentences.chinese: 最近，面包师为当地水族馆举行的慈善活动制作了这只章鱼，它拥有完整的触手和吸盘。

detailed_translations.english: a clear glass or plastic container for fish and other water animals

name: arable
trans: adj. 适于耕种的; n. 耕地 名 词: arability

sentences.english: arable farming
sentences.chinese: 耕作农业

sentences.english: arable land (=  land that is suitable for growing crops  )
sentences.chinese: 可耕地

detailed_translations.english: relating to growing crops

name: arduous
trans: adj. 费力的；努力的；险峻的 副 词: arduously 名 词: arduousness

sentences.english: ...a long, hot and arduous trip.
sentences.chinese: …一段漫长、灼热、艰难的旅程。

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of strength and effort

name: arena
trans: n. 竞技场；舞台

sentences.english: a sports arena
sentences.chinese: 运动场

sentences.english: an indoor arena
sentences.chinese: 室内剧场

detailed_translations.english: a building with a large flat central area surrounded by seats, where sports or entertainments take place

name: ascribe
trans: vt. 把…归于时 态: ascribed, ascribing, ascribes

sentences.english: The report ascribes the rise in childhood asthma to the increase in pollution.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告认为儿童哮喘发病率上升是因为污染加剧。

sentences.english: He ascribed his failure to bad luck.
sentences.chinese: 他认为自己的失败是运气不好。

detailed_translations.english: to claim that something is caused by a particular person, situation etc

name: ashamed
trans: adj. 惭愧的，感到难为情的；耻于……的

sentences.english: Everyone cries sometimes – it’s nothing to be ashamed of.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都会有哭的时候——没什么好难为情的。

detailed_translations.english: feeling very sorry and embarrassed because of something you have done

name: assimilation

sentences.english: She eagerly read every word, and asked me several questions about the people at the Grange.
sentences.chinese: 她急切地读着每一个字，还问了我几个关于画眉山庄里的人的问题。

name: earnest
trans: adj. 认真的，热心的；重要的; n. 定金；认真；诚挚 副 词: earnestly 名 词: earnestness

sentences.english: a rather earnest young man
sentences.chinese: 相当认真的一个年轻人

sentences.english: Matthews was in earnest conversation with a young girl.
sentences.chinese: 马修斯在和一个年轻姑娘认真地谈话。

sentences.english: an earnest desire to offer something useful to society
sentences.chinese: 为社会做贡献的真诚愿望

detailed_translations.english: very serious and sincere
if something starts happening in earnest, it begins properly – used when it was happening in a small or informal way before

name: eccentricity
trans: n. 古怪行为;反常

sentences.english: Kate’s mother had a reputation for eccentricity.
sentences.chinese: 凯特的母亲是个出了名的怪人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪；怪癖；[数] 离心率
detailed_translations.english: strange or unusual behaviour

name: edging
trans: n. 边饰,缘饰,边缘,流苏

name: ejection
trans: n. 喷出；排出物

sentences.english: The amount or rate of emission or ejection.
sentences.chinese: 排放量流量、流速，或排出量，排出的速度。

name: elapse
trans: vi. 时间过去；消逝; n. 时间的过去；流逝 时 态: elapsed, elapsing, elapses

sentences.english: Several months elapsed before his case was brought to trial.
sentences.chinese: 过了几个月他的案子才开审。

sentences.english: The assignment must be completed within an overall elapsed time of one week.
sentences.chinese: 这项任务总的时限为一周，必须按时完成。

detailed_translations.english: if a particular period of time elapses, it passes

name: elicit
trans: vt. 引出, 探出时 态: elicited, eliciting, elicits 名 词: elicitation 名 词: elicitor

sentences.english: My letters to her have elicited no response.
sentences.chinese: 我写给她的信没有得到回应。

detailed_translations.english: If you elicit a piece of information, you get it by asking the right questions

name: eligibility
trans: n. 适任,合格

name: elitist
trans: n. 优秀人才,杰出者; adj. 优秀人才的,杰出者的

name: eloquently
trans: adv. 善辩地;富于表现力地

name: elucidate
trans: vt. 阐明,解释时 态: elucidated, elucidating, elucidates 名 词: elucidation 形容词: elucidative ...

sentences.english: The full picture has not yet been elucidated.
sentences.chinese: 详细情况还没有解释清楚。

detailed_translations.english: to explain something that is difficult to understand by providing more information

name: embarrassment
trans: n. 尴尬;难堪;局促不安; 令人难堪或耻辱的事; 富人的苦恼；好东西太多无法作选择

sentences.english: He could not hide his embarrassment at his children’s rudeness.
sentences.chinese: 他无法掩饰自己孩子的无礼给他带来的难堪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 窘迫，难堪；使人为难的人或事物；拮据
detailed_translations.english: the feeling you have when you are embarrassed

name: embassy
trans: n. 大使馆；大使馆全体人员

sentences.english: the American Embassy in Paris
sentences.chinese: 美国驻巴黎大使馆

detailed_translations.chinese: 大使馆； 大使馆全体成员
detailed_translations.english: a group of officials who represent their government in a foreign country, or the building they work in

name: embellish
trans: vt. 美化；装饰；修饰；润色时 态: embellished，embellishing，embellishes

sentences.english: The boat was embellished with carvings in red and blue.
sentences.chinese: 这艘船饰有红、蓝雕刻。

detailed_translations.english: to make something more beautiful by adding decorations to it

name: embezzlement
trans: n. 盗用,挪用

name: embryonic
trans: adj. 胚芽的;胎儿的; 初期的

sentences.english: embryonic development
sentences.chinese: 胚胎的发育

sentences.english: embryonic cells
sentences.chinese: 胚胎细胞

detailed_translations.english: relating to an embryo

name: emergent
trans: adj. 紧急的；浮现的；新兴的；处于发展初期的

sentences.english: Discovering these patterns is the key to emergent design.
sentences.chinese: 发现这些模式是紧急设计的关键。

sentences.english: The real trick in emergent design is discovering these patterns.
sentences.chinese: 紧急设计的真正诀窍就是发现这些模式。

name: emeritus
trans: adj. 名誉退休的；退休的

sentences.english: ...emeritus professor of physics.
sentences.chinese: ...物理学荣誉教授。

sentences.english: He will continue as chairman emeritus.
sentences.chinese: 他将会继续担任荣誉主席。

detailed_translations.chinese: 保留头衔而退休的， 荣誉退休的
detailed_translations.english: Emeritus is used with a professional title to indicate that the person bearing it has retired but keeps the title as an honour

name: eminent
trans: adj. 杰出的；有名的；明显的 副 词: eminently

sentences.english: an eminent lawyer
sentences.chinese: 杰出的律师

detailed_translations.english: an eminent person is famous, important, and respected

name: empirical
trans: adj. 以观察或实验为依据的副 词: empirically

sentences.english: empirical evidence
sentences.chinese: 实验证据

detailed_translations.english: based on scientific testing or practical experience, not on ideas

name: encapsulate
trans: vt. 装入胶囊; 总结；扼要概括；囊括; adj. 有囊包着的 时 态: encapsulated，encapsulating，encapsulates 名 词: enca...

sentences.english: The words of the song neatly encapsulate the mood of the country at that time.
sentences.chinese: 这首歌的歌词言简意赅地表现出国家当时的氛围。

detailed_translations.chinese: 装入胶囊； 压缩； 总结， 概述
detailed_translations.english: to express or show something in a short way

name: endorse
trans: vt. 在背面签字；背书; 赞同，认可，支持; 在广告上说本人使用并赞同某产品; 在背面写评论；批注; 在记录违章事项 时 态: endorsed，endorsing，endorses...

sentences.english: I can endorse their opinion wholeheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 我可以全心全意地支持他们的观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背书；认可；签署；赞同；在背面签名
detailed_translations.english: to express formal support or approval for someone or something

name: enervation
trans: n. 无活力;衰弱

name: enfranchise
trans: vt. 给予选举权时 态: enfranchised, enfranchising, enfranchises 名 词: enfranchisement

sentences.english: The company voted to enfranchise its 120 women members.
sentences.chinese: 公司投票决定给予其120名女员工选举权。

detailed_translations.chinese: 给予选举权；给予自治权；解放，释放
detailed_translations.english: to give a group of people the right to vote

name: enigma
trans: n. 难于理解的问题、人、物、情况等;奥秘

sentences.english: Iran remains an enigma for the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗对外部世界而言依然是个谜。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe something or someone as an enigma, you mean they are mysterious or difficult to understand

name: enlighten
trans: vt. 启发, 开导时 态: enlightened, enlightening, enlightens

sentences.english: Baldwin enlightened her as to the nature of the experiment.
sentences.chinese: 鲍德温给她讲解了这个实验的性质。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone more knowledge and greater understanding about something

name: ensue
trans: vi. 跟着发生，接着发生；继起; vt. 追求 时 态: ensued, ensuing, ensues

sentences.english: If the Europeans did not reduce subsidies, a trade war would ensue.
sentences.chinese: 如果欧洲不减少补贴，贸易战将随即爆发。

detailed_translations.english: If something ensues, it happens immediately after another event, usually as a result of it

name: entice
trans: vt. 诱使；怂恿 时 态: enticed, enticing, entices 名 词: enticement

sentences.english: To influence or lead by means of wiles; entice.
sentences.chinese: 引诱，诱骗通过使用诡计来影响或怂恿；诱使。

sentences.english: To entice all the people looking for a loo-break to stay a bit longer, locals bought the antebellum houses and turned them into restaurants and inns.
sentences.chinese: 为了诱使那些原本只想小憩一会的过客待的更久一些，当地人买下内战前的房子，改装成餐馆和旅店。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something or go somewhere, usually by offering them something that they want

name: entrust
trans: vt. 委托，信托 时 态: entrusted, entrusting, entrusts

sentences.english: He entrusted his cash to a business partner for investment in a series of projects.
sentences.chinese: 他把现款委托给一个生意合伙人投资一系列项目。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone responsible for doing something important, or for taking care of someone

name: entwine
trans: vt. 缠绕,盘绕时 态: entwined, entwining, entwines

sentences.english: They walked together with their arms entwined.
sentences.chinese: 他们挽着胳膊一起走。

detailed_translations.english: to twist two things together or to wind one thing around another

name: epitomise
trans: vt. 成为的缩影

sentences.english: Avarice, embarrassment, boredom, depression, jealousy and love, for example, might epitomise the modern age.
sentences.chinese: 比如说，有可能象征现代的贪婪，尴尬，乏味，沮丧，嫉妒和爱等。

sentences.english: She was 16 when she started modelling in 1966 and by the late 80s the slender adolescent body had come to epitomise female beauty.
sentences.chinese: 她在1966年16岁时开始了模特生涯。 至80年代后期，青春期男孩般纤细的身材成为女性美的象征。

name: equality
trans: n. 同等, 平等

sentences.english: ...equality of the sexes.
sentences.chinese: …性别平等。

detailed_translations.chinese: 等同； 平等； 相等
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people have the same rights, advantages etc

name: equilibrium
trans: n. 平衡,均势; 平静

sentences.english: The government is anxious not to upset the economic equilibrium.
sentences.chinese: 政府急切希望不要打乱经济平衡。

detailed_translations.chinese: 均衡；平静；保持平衡的能力
detailed_translations.english: a balance between different people, groups, or forces that compete with each other, so that none is stronger than the others and a situation is not likely to change suddenly

name: erupt
trans: vi. 爆发, 喷发; 突然发生; 出疹 时 态: erupted, erupting, erupts 形容词: eruptive

sentences.english: Violence erupted after police shot a student during the demonstration.
sentences.chinese: 警察向示威人群中的一名学生开枪，暴乱随之发生。

sentences.english: A political row erupted over the MP’s comments.
sentences.chinese: 这名下院议员的评论引发了一场政治论战。

sentences.english: The volcano erupted in 1980, devastating a large area of Washington state.
sentences.chinese: 这座火山1980年喷发，摧毁了华盛顿州的大片地区。

detailed_translations.english: if fighting, violence, noise etc erupts, it starts suddenly

name: ethereal
trans: adj. 天上的；轻的；象空气的 名 词: ethereality 副 词: ethereally

sentences.english: ethereal beauty
sentences.chinese: 超凡的美丽

sentences.english: His music is ethereal.
sentences.chinese: 他的音乐超凡脱俗。

detailed_translations.chinese: 优雅的；轻飘的；缥缈的；超凡的
detailed_translations.english: very delicate and light, in a way that does not seem real

name: ethnicity
trans: n. 种族地位;种族特点;种族渊源

name: evil
trans: adj. 邪恶的；有害的；不幸的；讨厌的; n. 罪恶，邪恶；不幸 比较级: eviler, evilest 副 词: evilly 名 词: evilness

sentences.english: She wanted to protect her children from the evils of the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 她想保护她的孩子不受外界的不良影响。

sentences.english: Poverty is one of the greatest social evils of our time.
sentences.chinese: 贫困是当代最大的社会弊端之一。

sentences.english: the evils of capitalism
sentences.chinese: 资本主义的种种祸害

sentences.english: There is too much evil in the world.
sentences.chinese: 世上的罪恶太多。

sentences.english: an evil dictator responsible for the deaths of millions
sentences.chinese: 对数百万人之死负责的邪恶独裁者

detailed_translations.english: something that is very bad or harmful
someone who is evil deliberately does very cruel things to harm other people

name: expiry
trans: n. 满期，逾期；呼气；终结

sentences.english: The United Mine Workers are not on strike today, despite the expiry of their contract at midnight.
sentences.chinese: 联合矿业工会今天没有罢工，尽管他们的合同于午夜期满。

detailed_translations.english: The expiry of something such as a contract, deadline, or visa is the time that it comes to an end or stops being valid

name: extracurricular
trans: adj. 学校课程以外的

sentences.english: Each child had participated in extracurricular activities at school.
sentences.chinese: 每个孩子都参加了学校的课外活动。

detailed_translations.english: extracurricular activities are not part of the course that a student is doing at a school or college

name: extrapolation
trans: n. 推断; 外推

sentences.english: Most of was a bold extrapolation.
sentences.chinese: 大部分是一个大胆的推断。

name: extravagance
trans: n. 奢侈;挥霍; 奢侈品;放纵的言行等

sentences.english: When the company went under, tales of his extravagance surged through the industry.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司破产时，有关他的奢靡的传言传遍了整个业界。

detailed_translations.chinese: 奢侈，浪费；过度；放肆的言行
detailed_translations.english: Extravagance is the spending of more money than is reasonable or than you can afford

name: extrusion
trans: n. 挤出,推出,喷出,赶出

detailed_translations.chinese: 挤出， 推出， 挤压
detailed_translations.english: Extrusion is the act or process of extruding something

name: exuberant
trans: adj. 兴高采烈的；活跃的；愉快的; 茁壮的，繁茂的; adv. 兴高采烈地；活跃地；愉快地

sentences.english: exube-rant carvings
sentences.chinese: 充满生气的雕刻品

detailed_translations.chinese: 繁茂的；生气勃勃的，充溢的
detailed_translations.english: exuberant decorations, patterns etc are exciting and complicated or colourful

name: facilitator
trans: 服务商

name: facsimile
trans: n. 副本;传真

sentences.english: ...a facsimile edition of Beethoven's musical manuscripts.
sentences.chinese: ...一份贝多芬音乐手稿的摹本版。

detailed_translations.english: a  fax

name: familiarise
trans: vt. 使熟悉,使通晓

sentences.english: Here again, of course, you can always try some practice tests to familiarise yourself with the format.
sentences.chinese: 当然,为了熟悉考试形式你也可以做一些测试练习。

sentences.english: I began to familiarise myself with my new body: the grill, the bread bin, the speaker and the spring mechanism.
sentences.chinese: 我开始熟悉自己的新身体：烤盘、面包箱、话筒和弹簧装置。

sentences.english: The reason you want to familiarise yourself with the camera is that when you read the manual and it refers to a button with a star and moon you will know where it is.
sentences.chinese: 要熟悉相机的理由是，当你阅读说明书时，对上面提到的按键你都知道在哪里。

name: farewell
trans: n. 告别, 欢送

sentences.english: Mourners gathered to bid farewell to the victims of the plane tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 哀悼者来向空难受害者告别。

sentences.english: a farewell speech
sentences.chinese: 告别演说

detailed_translations.english: the action of saying goodbye

detailed_translations.chinese: 别了！（常含有永别或不容易再见面的意思）；再会！
detailed_translations.english: the action of saying goodbye

name: fatal
trans: adj. 致命的; 灾难性的; 重大的, 决定性的

sentences.english: potentially fatal diseases
sentences.chinese: 潜在致命的疾病

sentences.english: If it is not treated correctly, the condition can prove fatal (= be fatal ) .
sentences.chinese: 如果治疗不当，这种病可能会致命。

detailed_translations.english: resulting in someone’s death

name: feminism
trans: n. 女权运动；女权主义；女性主义

sentences.english: ...Barbara Johnson, that champion of radical feminism.
sentences.chinese: …芭芭拉·约翰逊，激进女权主义的拥护者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 女权主义；女权运动；男女平等主义
detailed_translations.english: the belief that women should have the same rights and opportunities as men

name: fickle
trans: adj. 易变的；浮躁的；变幻无常的 名 词: fickleness

sentences.english: an unpredictable and fickle lover
sentences.chinese: 一个捉摸不透、三心二意的情人

detailed_translations.chinese: 浮躁的；易变的；变幻无常的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is fickle is always changing their mind about people or things that they like, so that you cannot depend on them – used to show disapproval

name: fidelity
trans: n. 保真度；忠诚；尽责；精确

sentences.english: the importance of marital fidelity
sentences.chinese: 对婚姻忠贞的重要性

detailed_translations.english: when you are loyal to your husband, girlfriend etc, by not having sex with anyone else

name: filler
trans: n. 补白；装填者；装填物；充填器

name: finitude
trans: n. 有限；界限；限制

sentences.english: To Kierkegaard, the finitude, understood as the body of the self in this paper, and the infinitude, the so-called inward imagination in Kierkegaard s text, is in absolute contradiction.
sentences.chinese: 克尔恺郭尔认为人的有限性（即本文称为肉身的方面）与人的无限性（一种纵深扩张的想象力）是不可调和的，在具体的生存过程中，这不可调和的两方面转化为必然性与可能性之间的对立。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有限； 限定， 界限

name: fledgling
trans: n. 幼鸟; 无经验的人

sentences.english: a fledgling republic
sentences.chinese: 一个新兴的共和国

detailed_translations.english: a fledgling state or organization has only recently been formed and is still developing
a young bird that is learning to fly

name: flimsy
trans: adj. 脆弱的；浅薄的；易损坏的；不周密的; n. 薄纸；复写纸；打字纸 比较级: flimsier, flimsiest 副 词: flimsily 名 词: ...

sentences.english: a flimsy cotton dress
sentences.chinese: 一件又轻又薄的棉布连衣裙

detailed_translations.chinese: 脆弱的；浅薄的；易损坏的；不周密的
detailed_translations.english: flimsy cloth or clothing is light and thin

name: flip
trans: vt. 轻击；掷; vi. 用指轻弹；蹦跳; adj. 无礼的；轻率的; n. 筋斗；弹 FLIPabbr. Floating Indeved Point Arithmetic 变...

sentences.english: I was fed up with his flip comments.
sentences.chinese: 我听够了他那些轻率的评论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 〈口〉无理的， 轻率的， 轻浮的
detailed_translations.english: not said or meant seriously
to move something with a quick sudden movement so that it is in a different position
an action in which you make a flat object such as a coin go upwards and turn over in the air

name: flock
trans: n. 群；棉束; vt. 用棉束填满; vi. 聚集；成群而行 Flock弗洛克时 态: flocked, flocking, flocks

sentences.english: People have been flocking to the exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 看展览的人络绎不绝。

detailed_translations.english: to go or gather together somewhere in large numbers

name: fluent
trans: adj. 熟练的, 流畅的; 流利的 名 词: fluency 副 词: fluently

sentences.english: She was fluent in English, French, and German.
sentences.chinese: 她的英语、法语和德语都很流利。

detailed_translations.english: able to speak a language very well

name: flustered
trans: adj. 慌张的；激动不安的 v. 慌张；混乱

sentences.english: Paul was looking flustered and embarrassed.
sentences.chinese: 保罗看上去神情慌乱，一脸窘迫。

sentences.english: I always get flustered in interviews.
sentences.chinese: 我面试时老是紧张。

detailed_translations.chinese: 慌张的， 激动不安的
detailed_translations.english: confused and nervous

name: foe
trans: n. 敌人, 仇敌

sentences.english: Britain’s friends and foes
sentences.chinese: 英国的朋友和敌人

detailed_translations.english: an enemy

name: foil
trans: n. 箔，金属薄片; 陪衬，衬托; vt. 挫败；使受挫折 时 态: foiled，foiling，foils

sentences.english: A massive arms-smuggling plan has been foiled by the CIA.
sentences.chinese: 一项大规模的军火走私计划已被中央情报局挫败。

detailed_translations.chinese: 衬托；阻止，挡开；挫败；贴箔于
detailed_translations.english: to prevent something bad that someone is planning to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 箔，金属薄片；衬托，烘托；叶形片

detailed_translations.english: a heady smell, drink etc is pleasantly strong and seems to affect you strongly

name: hedge
trans: vt. 用树篱笆围住；避免作正面答复; vi. 用树篱围住；避免作正面答复; n. 树篱；障碍 时 态: hedged, hedging, hedges 名 词: hed...

sentences.english: You’re hedging again - have you got the money or haven’t you?
sentences.chinese: 你又在闪烁其词了，你究竟有没有钱？

sentences.english: ‘That depends on my partner,’ she hedged.
sentences.chinese: “那取决于我的合伙人。”她避重就轻地答道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 避免直接回答；   套头交易； 以套期保值避免损失
detailed_translations.english: to avoid giving a direct answer to a question

detailed_translations.chinese: 保值措施；套期保值；树篱；防备；障碍物；套头，两面下注以避免损失
detailed_translations.english: a row of small bushes or trees growing close together, usually dividing one field or garden from another

name: hiccup
trans: n. 嗝，呃逆; 连续地打嗝; 暂时性的小问题；短暂的停顿 时 态: hiccupped also hiccoughed hiccupping hiccoughing hiccups ...

sentences.english: A baby may frequently get a bout of hiccups during or soon after a feeding.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿在进食时或进食后常常会打一阵嗝儿。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden repeated stopping of the breath, usually caused by eating or drinking too fast
to have hiccups

name: hierarchy
trans: n. 等级制度; 统治集团, 领导层

sentences.english: a rigid social hierarchy
sentences.chinese: 严格的社会等级制度

sentences.english: She worked her way up through the corporate hierarchy to become president.
sentences.chinese: 她在公司一步一步升到了总裁的位置。

detailed_translations.english: a system of organization in which people or things are divided into levels of importance

name: hiker
trans: n. 远足者, 长途旅行者

sentences.english: A hiker takes in the view from the trail to King’s Throne in Yukon’s Kluane National Park and Reserve.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大育空地区的克卢恩国家公园和保护区里，一个徒步旅行者在观看去"国王宝座"的路径。

sentences.english: Probably just a hiker or a bird-watcher, Jesse figured, that or some punk looking to poach someone's marijuana, not knowing the ginseng was worth even more.
sentences.chinese: 也许只是一个徒步旅行者或者观鸟人，杰希推测到。 或许是一些小流氓想要偷一些别人的大麻，而不知道人参要更值钱。

sentences.english: The son of a retired marine, Bernard, from New Portland in rural Maine, was described as a devout Christian, an Iraq war veteran, a keen snowboarder and an avid hiker.
sentences.chinese: 伯纳德是一名退休军人的儿子，来自缅因州的农村新波特兰市。 人们说他是虔诚的基督徒，伊战士兵，钟爱滑雪，喜欢徒步旅行。

detailed_translations.english: someone who walks long distances in the mountains or country for pleasure

name: hindquarters
trans: n. 后臀及后腿

detailed_translations.chinese: （动物的）尾部；两条后腿；半边胴体的后半部（hindquarter的复数）
detailed_translations.english: the back part of an animal with four legs

name: hindrance
trans: n. 起妨碍作用的事物或人

sentences.english: A degree is more of a hindrance than a help in British industry.
sentences.chinese: 在英国工业界，学位反倒是个累赘。

detailed_translations.english: something or someone that makes it difficult for you to do something

name: homogenous
trans: adj. 同质的,纯系的

name: honoraria
trans: 谢礼

name: hormonal
trans: adj. 荷尔蒙的,激素的

sentences.english: ...our individual hormonal balance.
sentences.chinese: …我们个体的荷尔蒙平衡。

detailed_translations.english: Hormonal means relating to or involving hormones

name: hostile
trans: adj. 怀有敌意的, 不友善的; 敌人的, 敌方的

sentences.english: Southampton fans gave their former coach a hostile reception .
sentences.chinese: 南安普敦队的球迷对球队的前任教练很不友善。

sentences.english: Carr wouldn’t meet Feng’s stare, which was openly hostile .
sentences.chinese: 卡尔不愿意面对冯公然敌视的目光。

sentences.english: his hostile attitude
sentences.chinese: 他敌对的态度

detailed_translations.english: angry and deliberately unfriendly towards someone, and ready to argue with them

name: hover
trans: vi. 盘旋; 徘徊, 走来走去; 犹豫, 摇摆不定 时 态: hovered, hovering, hovers 名 词: hoverer

sentences.english: Her younger brother hovered in the background watching us.
sentences.chinese: 她的弟弟在后面走来走去，观察着我们。

detailed_translations.english: if a bird, insect, or  helicopter  hovers, it stays in one place in the air

name: hunch
trans: n. 预感；大块；肉峰 vt. 耸肩；预感到；弯腰驼背 vi. 隆起；向前移动时 态: hunched, hunching, hunches

sentences.english: I had a hunch that Susan and I would work well together.
sentences.chinese: 我凭直觉感到我和苏珊共事会很融洽。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a hunch that something is true or will happen, you feel that it is true or will happen
to raise your shoulders into a rounded shape because you are cold, anxious etc

name: hurdle
trans: n. 障碍；跳栏；栏; vt. 克服; vi. 克服；跳过 时 态: hurdled, hurdling, hurdles 名 词: hurdler

sentences.english: Finding enough money for the project was the first hurdle.
sentences.chinese: 第一道难关是为该项目筹措足够的资金。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or difficulty that you must deal with before you can achieve something

name: hydropower
trans: n. 水力发出的电力

sentences.english: If we do it ourselves, only cheap energy from hydropower will do.
sentences.chinese: 如果靠自力更生，只有靠水电站带来的廉价能源了。

sentences.english: Developing hydropower more quickly would allow for increasing the renewable energy target above the envisaged government target without increasing the incremental cost of the program.
sentences.chinese: 加快发展水电可以在不增加整个可再生能源开发方案总成本的同时，实现可再生能源发展的新目标。

detailed_translations.english: hydroelectric power

name: hype
trans: n. 天花乱坠的广告宣传; vt. 大肆宣传; 夸张地宣传; 人为地刺激,助长; 十分兴奋的；很激动的；十分担忧的; 被大肆宣扬的 时 态: hyped, hyping, hypes

sentences.english: Some experts are concerned that the new drug won’t live up to all the hype.
sentences.chinese: 一些专家担心这种新药并不像宣传中那么好。

sentences.english: Despite the media hype , I found the film very disappointing.
sentences.chinese: 尽管媒体大肆炒作，我还是觉得这部影片很让人失望。

detailed_translations.english: attempts to make people think something is good or important by talking about it a lot on television, the radio etc – used to show disapproval
to try to make people think something is good or important by talking about it a lot on television, the radio etc

name: hypnotic
trans: adj. 催眠的，催眠术的；易于催眠的; n. 安眠药；催眠状态的人 副 词: hypnotically

sentences.english: a hypnotic trance
sentences.chinese: 催眠后的恍惚状态

detailed_translations.chinese: 催眠的，催眠术的；易于催眠的
detailed_translations.english: relating to  hypnosis
a drug that helps you to sleep

name: iconic
trans: adj. 图标的，形象的

name: idiom
trans: n. 成语，习语；土话

sentences.english: ..familiar idioms and metaphors, such as "turning over a new leaf.
sentences.chinese: …如“翻开新的一页”这样熟悉的习语和比喻。

detailed_translations.english: a group of words that has a special meaning that is different from the ordinary meaning of each separate word. For example, ‘under the weather’ is an idiom meaning ‘ill’.

name: idiosyncratic
trans: adj. 特殊物质的,特殊的,异质的

sentences.english: ...a highly idiosyncratic personality.
sentences.chinese: ...一种非常另类的个性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特殊物质的， 特殊的， 异质的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone's actions or characteristics as idiosyncratic, you mean that they are somewhat unusual

name: idyllic
trans: adj. 牧歌的，田园诗的

sentences.english: This idyllic pastoral scene is only part of the picture.
sentences.chinese: 但这种田园诗般的乡村风光仅仅是一个侧面。

sentences.english: Some believe that lemurians were much more like early humans living in a sort of idyllic paradise largely agrarian with lush forests and an abundance of flowers and fruit trees.
sentences.chinese: 一些就相信利莫里亚更加像早期的人类，生活在一种田园诗般的天堂里，主要地与繁荣的森林，盛开的花朵和结果的树在一起。

sentences.english: I don't mind a bit of idiosyncrasy, but that strange ideology you believe in , coupled with your idyllic ideas on life, suggest to me that all you're doing is looking for some idol to follow.
sentences.chinese: 你有一点特殊的癖性我不在乎，但你相信的那种奇怪的意识形态，加上你向往田园诗般生活的想法，给我的印象是你在做的就是要找到一个偶像来效仿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 田园诗般的， 田园风光的， 牧歌的

name: illusion
trans: n. 错觉, 幻想, 错误观念; 假象 形容词: illusionless

sentences.english: She was under no illusion that he loved her.
sentences.chinese: 她不再幻想他爱她了。

sentences.english: It is an illusion that the Arctic is dark in winter.
sentences.chinese: 认为北极冬天一片黑暗是错误的。

sentences.english: She had no illusions about her physical attractiveness.
sentences.chinese: 她对自己外表的吸引力不抱幻想。

sentences.english: ‘I hate to shatter your illusions,’ he said.
sentences.chinese: “我不愿意打破你的幻想。”他说。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幻想， 错误的观念； 错觉， 幻觉， 假象
detailed_translations.english: an idea or opinion that is wrong, especially about yourself

name: imitation
trans: n. 模仿, 仿效; 仿制品, 伪造物 形容词: imitational

sentences.english: The remake of ‘Casablanca’ was a pale imitation (= something that is much less good than the thing it imitates ) of the original movie.
sentences.chinese: 重拍的《卡萨布兰卡》远不如原版。

sentences.english: ...a complete set of Dickens bound in imitation leather.
sentences.chinese: …用人造革装帧的一整套《狄更斯全集》。

detailed_translations.english: when you copy someone else’s actions
Imitation things are not genuine but are made to look as if they are

name: immerse
trans: vt. 沉浸；使陷入 时 态: immersed, immersing, immerses

sentences.english: She immersed herself in her work.
sentences.chinese: 她埋头工作。

detailed_translations.english: to become or make sb completely involved in sth

name: immigration
trans: n. 移民局检查站; 移民

sentences.english: He called for a common European policy on immigration.
sentences.chinese: 他要求欧洲国家实施共同的移民政策。

detailed_translations.english: the process of entering another country in order to live there permanently

name: impartial
trans: adj. 不偏不倚的；公平的，公正的 名 词: impartiality 副 词: impartially

sentences.english: We offer impartial advice on tax and insurance.
sentences.chinese: 我们就税收和保险问题提供公充的建议。

sentences.english: an impartial inquiry into the deaths
sentences.chinese: 对死亡事件的公正调查

sentences.english: an impartial observer
sentences.chinese: 公正的观察员

detailed_translations.chinese: 公平的，公正的；不偏不倚的
detailed_translations.english: not involved in a particular situation, and therefore able to give a fair opinion or piece of advice

name: impede
trans: vt. 阻止；妨碍；阻碍 时 态: impeded, impeding, impedes

sentences.english: Storms at sea impeded our progress.
sentences.chinese: 海上风暴阻碍了我们的航程。

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for someone or something to move forward or make progress

name: imperative
trans: adj. 必要的, 紧急的, 极重要的; 命令的; 祈使的; n. 必要的事, 必须完成的事; 祈使语气 副 词: imperatively

sentences.english: It is imperative that politicians should be good communicators.
sentences.chinese: 政治家应该是很好的沟通者，这很重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的；紧急的，极重要的；命令的
detailed_translations.english: extremely important and needing to be done or dealt with immediately

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的事， 必须完成的事； 【语】祈使语气
detailed_translations.english: something that must be done urgently

name: impetus
trans: n. 促进；动力；冲力

sentences.english: The discovery gave fresh impetus to the research.
sentences.chinese: 这个发现为研究带来新动力。

detailed_translations.english: an influence that makes something happen or makes it happen more quickly

name: impinge
trans: vi. 撞击；侵犯; vt. 撞击 时 态: impinged, impinging, impinges 名 词: impingement 名 词: imping...

sentences.english: Yet if those systems seriously impinge on people’s freedom, many people will balk.
sentences.chinese: 然而如果这些系统严重侵犯了人们的自由的话，许多人将会停滞不前。

sentences.english: There's also a liberal revolution in the moral sphere that says the state shouldn't impinge on choices about marriage, family structure, the role of women.
sentences.chinese: 还有一种道德层面的自由主义革命，说的是国家不应该侵犯婚姻、家庭结构和女性角色这些个人选择问题。

name: implicate
trans: vt. 牵连, 涉及时 态: implicated, implicating, implicates

sentences.english: The allegations implicated Abe to such an extent he was forced to resign.
sentences.chinese: 安倍深受指控牵连，不得不辞职。

detailed_translations.english: to show or suggest that someone is involved in a crime or dishonest act

name: importation
trans: n. 进口;输入; 进口货;输入物

sentences.english: We should stop the importation of these birds which are sold as commodities and endure lives of boredom in cages.
sentences.chinese: 这种作为商品出售的鸟被关在笼子里忍耐着无聊的生活，我们应当停止它的进口。

sentences.english: While not legally binding the new levels allow countries to refuse to allow the importation of products with excessive levels of melamine.
sentences.chinese: 这一最新含量虽然不具法律约束力，但可使各国政府拒绝进口三聚氰胺含量过高的产品。

detailed_translations.english: the act of bringing something new or different to a place where it did not previously exist, or something that arrives in this way

name: impoverished
trans: adj. 穷困的,无力的,用尽了的

sentences.english: It is the lament of an impoverished peasant.
sentences.chinese: 它是一个已贫穷化的农民的哀词。

sentences.english: He dropped the gold down the chimney to save face for the impoverished father.
sentences.chinese: 他将黄金扔进烟囱以保留这位穷困的父亲的脸面。

sentences.english: The grants did give new opportunities to many impoverished farmers from the East and Midwest, but much of the land granted under the Homestead Act fell quickly into the hands of speculators.
sentences.chinese: 这些赠拨确实了为来自东部和中西部穷困潦倒的农民带来了一个新的机遇，但是大部分《宅地法》赠拨的土地很快落入了投机者的手中。

name: improvise
trans: vt. & vi. 临时制作, 临时凑成时 态: improvised, improvising, improvises 名 词: improviser

sentences.english: I forgot to bring my notes, so I had to improvise.
sentences.chinese: 我忘了带笔记，只好临时发挥。

detailed_translations.english: to do something without any preparation, because you are forced to do this by unexpected events

name: inaccessible
trans: adj. 达不到的, 不可及的名 词: inaccessibility 副 词: inaccessibly

sentences.english: In winter, the villages are inaccessible by road.
sentences.chinese: 冬天时，进入这些村子的路很难走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 难达到的；难接近的；难见到的
detailed_translations.english: difficult or impossible to reach

name: inaugurate
trans: vt. 为…举行就职典礼; 为…举行仪式, 为…举行落成仪式; 开创, 创始 时 态: inaugurated, inaugurating, inaugurates 名 词: ...

sentences.english: He will be inaugurated (as) President in January.
sentences.chinese: 他将于一月份就任总统。

sentences.english: The moon landing inaugurated a new era in space exploration.
sentences.chinese: 登陆月球开创了太空探索的新纪元。

detailed_translations.english: to introduce a new public official or leader at a special ceremony

name: incapacitate
trans: vt. 使无能力,使不适合时 态: incapacitated, incapacitating, incapacitates 名 词: incapacitation

sentences.english: Her mother has been incapacitated by a fall.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲摔了一跤后，失去了正常生活能力。

sentences.english: an incapacitating injury
sentences.chinese: 使人失去活动能力的伤

detailed_translations.chinese: 使无能力；使不能；使不适于
detailed_translations.english: to make you too ill or weak to live and work normally

name: incineration
trans: n. 焚化;烧成灰

sentences.english: Dioxins are unwanted byproducts of some industrial processes and waste incineration.
sentences.chinese: 二恶英是一些工业过程和废物焚化的有害副产品。

sentences.english: Very few plants have provisions for the separate disposal of grease to scavengers or by incineration.
sentences.chinese: 几乎没有工厂采用清除器对油脂进行分别处置，或采用焚化进行处置的措施。

sentences.english: Senior middle school or above with 2 years' operating experience in incineration plant, power or cogeneration plant, chemical plant. Or.
sentences.chinese: 高中及以上学历：焚化厂、热电厂或化工厂2年以上生产操作工作经验；

name: inclination
trans: n. 爱好, 癖好, 意向; 倾向, 趋向, 趋势; 倾斜, 弯腰, 曲身, 点头; 斜坡, 斜面

sentences.english: My natural inclination was to say no.
sentences.chinese: 我生性爱说“不”。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that makes you want to do something

name: incompatible
trans: adj. 合不来的，不能和谐相处的；不协调的，不相配的副 词: incompatibly

sentences.english: Politeness and truth are often mutually incompatible.
sentences.chinese: 礼貌和实话往往互不相容。

sentences.english: Business interests are incompatible with public office.
sentences.chinese: 商业利益与公职不可兼得。

detailed_translations.english: two things that are incompatible cannot exist or be accepted together

name: incongruous
trans: adj. 不协调的, 不和谐的, 不一致的, 不相称的副 词: incongruously

sentences.english: The new theatre looks utterly incongruous in its setting.
sentences.chinese: 这座新剧院和周围的环境格格不入。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不协调的；不一致的；不和谐的
detailed_translations.english: strange, unexpected, or unsuitable in a particular situation

name: incredible
trans: adj. 不能相信的, 不可信的; 〈非正〉难以置信的, 不可思议的, 惊人的 副 词: incredibly

sentences.english: It’s incredible that he survived the fall.
sentences.chinese: 他跌下去竟然能够生还，真不可思议。

sentences.english: It’s incredible how much Tom has changed since he met Sally.
sentences.chinese: 自从遇见萨莉后，汤姆的变化之大简直令人难以置信。

sentences.english: I find it almost incredible that no one noticed these errors.
sentences.chinese: 没人发现这些错误，真让我无法相信。

detailed_translations.english: too strange to be believed, or very difficult to believe

name: increment
trans: n. 增长; 增额 形容词: incremental

sentences.english: The average yearly increment in productivity was 4.5 per cent.
sentences.chinese: 生产率的年平均增长量是4.5%。

detailed_translations.english: the amount by which a number, value, or amount increases

name: inedible
trans: adj. 不能吃的 名 词: inedibility

sentences.english: The meat was so burnt that it was inedible.
sentences.chinese: 肉烧得那么焦，不能吃了。

detailed_translations.english: if something is inedible, you cannot eat it because it tastes bad or is poisonous

name: infirmity
trans: n. 体弱，虚弱; 疾病，病症

sentences.english: Health is a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being and not merely the absence of disease or infirmity.
sentences.chinese: 健康是身体的、心理的及社会的达到完全安适状态，而不仅是没有疾病或身体虚弱而已。

sentences.english: Workers lose productivity by interrupting a business meeting and disrupt social gatherings because of their infirmity, the report said.
sentences.chinese: 报告中说，因为工人们的虚弱，通过中断了业务会议而失去生产效率，并且破坏了社交聚会的范围。

detailed_translations.english: bad health or a particular illness

name: inflation
trans: n. 膨胀; 通货膨胀

sentences.english: Inflation is now at over 16%.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率现已超过16%。

detailed_translations.english: a continuing increase in prices, or the rate at which prices increase

name: inflict
trans: vt. 把…强加给, 使承受, 遭受时 态: inflicted, inflicting, inflicts 形容词: inflictive

sentences.english: ...the damage being inflicted on industries by the recession.
sentences.chinese: …经济衰退给工业造成的损失。

detailed_translations.chinese: 造成；使遭受（损伤、痛苦等）；给予（打击等）
detailed_translations.english: To inflict harm or damage on someone or something means to make them suffer it

name: influenza
trans: n. 流行性感冒

sentences.chinese: 一根光纤探针

sentences.chinese: 外科医生会拿起器械进行探查、修复，然后再缝合。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin metal instrument that doctors and scientists use to examine parts of the body
to look for something or examine something, using a long thin object

name: processor
trans: n. 加工、处理事物的人〔设备、产业〕; 中央处理器; 数据处理机

sentences.english: US tuna processors
sentences.chinese: 美国的金枪鱼加工厂商

detailed_translations.chinese: [计] 处理器；处理程序；加工者
detailed_translations.english: the central part of a computer that deals with the commands and information it is given

name: procrastination
trans: n. 延迟,拖延

name: prodigious
trans: adj. 异常的，惊人的，奇异的；巨大的; adv. 异常地，惊人地；巨大地

sentences.english: the artist’s prodigious output
sentences.chinese: 那位艺术家惊人的高产

detailed_translations.chinese: 惊人的，异常的，奇妙的；巨大的
detailed_translations.english: very large or great in a surprising or impressive way

name: profitably
trans: adv. 有利地;有益地

name: progressively
trans: adv. 前进地;日益增加地

name: prohibitive
trans: adj. 禁止使用或购买的,禁止性的; 高得买不起的; 禁止的; adv. 禁止地; n. 禁止 副 词: prohibitively

sentences.english: prohibitive regulations
sentences.chinese: 禁律

detailed_translations.chinese: 禁止的，禁止性的；抑制的；（费用，价格等）过高的；类同禁止的
detailed_translations.english: a prohibitive rule prevents people from doing things

name: projector
trans: n. 电影放映机, 幻灯机

sentences.english: ...a slide projector.
sentences.chinese: …幻灯机。

detailed_translations.chinese: [仪] 投影仪；放映机；探照灯；设计者
detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a film or picture appear on a screen or flat surface

name: proliferate
trans: vi. 激增；繁殖；增生; 扩散 时 态: proliferated，proliferating，proliferates 名 词: proliferation 形容词:...

sentences.english: Computer courses continue to proliferate.
sentences.chinese: 计算机课程层出不穷。

detailed_translations.english: if something proliferates, it increases quickly and spreads to many different places

name: prominence
trans: n. 声望，杰出; 突出；重要；要事

sentences.english: He came to prominence during the World Cup.
sentences.chinese: 他在该世界杯期间一举成名。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of being important and well known

name: pronunciation
trans: n. 发音; 读法; 发音, 发音方式

sentences.english: She gave the word its French pronunciation.
sentences.chinese: 她给出了这个单词的法语发音。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which a language or a particular word is pronounced

name: prop
trans: n. 支柱, 支柱物; vt. 支撑, 支持, 维持 时 态: propped, propping, props

sentences.english: Anna looks after costumes and props.
sentences.chinese: 安娜管理服装和道具。

detailed_translations.chinese: 支柱，支撑物；支持者；道具；（橄榄球中的）支柱前锋
detailed_translations.english: an object placed under or against something to hold it in a particular position

detailed_translations.chinese: 支撑，支持，维持；使倚靠在某物上
detailed_translations.english: to support something by leaning it against something, or by putting something else under, next to, or behind it

name: propellant
trans: adj. 推进的; n. 推进物

sentences.english: ...a propellant for nuclear rockets.
sentences.chinese: ...一批核火箭燃料。

detailed_translations.chinese: 推进物；推进燃料；发射火药
detailed_translations.english: an explosive for firing a bullet or  rocket

name: prospectus
trans: n. 章程,简章,简介

sentences.english: ...a prospectus for a new issue of stock.
sentences.chinese: …新发行股票的招股说明书。

detailed_translations.chinese: 内容说明书；样张；创办计划书；学校的入学简介
detailed_translations.english: A prospectus is a detailed document produced by a company, college, or school, which gives details about it

name: proximity
trans: n. 接近, 附近

sentences.english: Here the rich and the poor live in close proximity (= very near to each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 在这里，富人和穷人比邻而居。

detailed_translations.english: nearness in distance or time

name: proxy
trans: n. 代表权；代理权；代理人，代表 Proxy代理服务器，即Proxy服务器，在互联网上的完成跑腿服务。当你在浏览器中设置了某个Proxy服务器之后，由你的浏览器所发出的任何要求，都会被送...

sentences.english: You can vote by proxy.
sentences.chinese: 你可以请人代你投票。

detailed_translations.english: if you do something by proxy, you arrange for someone else to do it for you

name: puff
trans: vt. 喷出，张开；夸张；使膨胀；使骄傲自满; vi. 张开；鼓吹；夸张；膨胀; n. 一阵喷烟；粉扑；泡芙；蓬松；肿块；吹嘘，宣传广告 时 态: puffed, puffing,...

sentences.english: Steam puffed out of the chimney.
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽从烟囱里一股一股地喷出来。

sentences.english: The boiler was puffing thick black smoke.
sentences.chinese: 锅炉一股股地冒出浓浓的黑烟。

sentences.english: Don’t puff smoke into my face.
sentences.chinese: 别把烟朝我脸上喷。

sentences.english: I took a puff on the cigarette and started coughing.
sentences.chinese: 我抽了一口烟就开始咳嗽起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 喷出，张开；使膨胀；夸张；使骄傲自满
detailed_translations.english: if smoke, steam etc puffs from somewhere, or if something puffs it, it comes out in little clouds

detailed_translations.chinese: 粉扑；泡芙；蓬松；一阵喷烟；肿块；吹嘘，宣传广告
detailed_translations.english: Puff is also a noun

name: puncture
trans: n. 小孔；轮胎穿孔; vt. 在上穿孔；刺穿; 削弱；泄某人的气; vi. 被刺穿 时 态: punctured，puncturing，punctures 形容词: pun...

sentences.english: She was cycling home when she had a puncture .
sentences.chinese: 她骑车回家途中轮胎被扎破了。

detailed_translations.english: a small hole made accidentally in a tyre
if a tyre punctures, or if you puncture it, a small hole appears in it

name: puppetry
trans: n. 木偶；傀儡；木偶戏

name: purist
trans: n. 纯化论者，力求纯化的人 形容词: puristic

name: pyrotechnics
trans: n. 烟火制造术,烟火使用名 词: pyrotechnist

name: quest
trans: n. 追求；寻找; vi. 寻找；追求; vt. 探索 时 态: quested, questing, quests 名 词: quester

sentences.english: He had been questing for religious belief from an early age.
sentences.chinese: 他从早年开始就一直在寻求宗教信仰。

sentences.english: ...his questing mind and boundless enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: …他的探索型头脑和无限的热情

detailed_translations.english: to search for sth that is difficult to find

name: quiz
trans: n. 问答比赛; 〈尤美〉小测验 时 态: quizzed, quizzing, quizzes 名 词: quizzer

sentences.english: a love quiz in a magazine
sentences.chinese: 杂志上的爱情问答

sentences.english: a general knowledge quiz
sentences.chinese: 常识问答竞赛

detailed_translations.chinese: 智力竞赛，问答比赛；小测验
detailed_translations.english: a competition or game in which people have to answer questions
to ask someone a lot of questions

name: quote
trans: vt. 引述；举证；报价; vi. 引用；引证；报价; n. 引用 时 态: quoted, quoting, quotes 名 词: quoter

sentences.english: He quoted a short passage from the Bible.
sentences.chinese: 他引用了《圣经》里的一小段。

sentences.english: A military spokesman was quoted as saying that the border area is now safe.
sentences.chinese: 报道引述军方一位发言人的话，说边境地区现在很安全。

sentences.english: They quoted a price of £15,000.
sentences.chinese: 他们报价1.5万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: to repeat exactly what someone else has said or written

name: rash
trans: n. 发疹，疹子; adj. 太急速的；鲁莽的；轻率的 比较级: rasher，rashest 副 词: rashly 名 词: rashness

sentences.english: Please Jessie, don’t do anything rash.
sentences.chinese: 求你了，杰西，不要草率行事。

sentences.english: Don’t go making any rash decisions about your future!
sentences.chinese: 不要对你的未来贸然作决定！

sentences.english: It was rather rash of you to lend them your car.
sentences.chinese: 你把汽车借给他们实在有欠考虑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻率的；鲁莽的；不顾后果的
detailed_translations.english: if you are rash, you do things too quickly, without thinking carefully about whether they are sensible or not

detailed_translations.chinese: [皮肤] 皮疹；突然大量出现的事物
detailed_translations.english: a lot of red spots on someone’s skin, caused by an illness

name: rationale
trans: n. 理由;逻辑依据

sentences.english: However, the rationale for such initiatives is not, of course, solely economic.
sentences.chinese: 但是，这些积极行动的根本原因当然不全是出于经济目的。

name: reactive
trans: adj. 反应的; 起反应的; 易起化学反应的,活性的 副 词: reactively

sentences.english: a reactive foreign policy
sentences.chinese: 回应式的外交政策

detailed_translations.english: reacting to events or situations rather than starting or doing new things yourself

name: realm
trans: n. 领域；范围; 王国，国度

sentences.english: the spiritual realm
sentences.chinese: 精神领域

detailed_translations.english: a general area of knowledge, activity, or thought

name: reassure
trans: vt. 消除恐惧或疑虑；恢复信心时 态: reassured，reassuring，reassures 名 词: reassurance 副 词: reassuring...

sentences.english: Teachers reassured anxious parents.
sentences.chinese: 老师们安慰焦急的父母。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel calmer and less worried or frightened about a problem or situation

name: rebound
trans: vi. 弹回；反弹; 产生反作用；未能奏效; 处于伤心困惑的状态，心灰意懒之余 时 态: rebounded，rebounding，rebounds 名 词: rebound...

sentences.english: Share prices rebounded today after last week’s losses.
sentences.chinese: 股票价格在上周下跌之后，今天出现了反弹。

detailed_translations.english: an act of catching a  basketball  after a player has tried but failed to get a point
if a ball or other moving object rebounds, it moves quickly back away from something it has just hit

name: recede
trans: vi. 后退；减弱; vt. 归还 时 态: receded, receding, recedes

sentences.english: The flood waters finally began to recede in November.
sentences.chinese: 11 月，洪水终于开始退去。

detailed_translations.english: if water recedes, it moves back from an area that it was covering

name: reciprocity
trans: n. 相互性; 相互作用; 互给,互惠

sentences.english: They said they would press for reciprocity with Greece in the issuing of visas.
sentences.chinese: 他们说，他们将会对希腊施压，以达成签证发放的互惠。

detailed_translations.chinese: 相互作用（复数reciprocities）；相互性；互惠主义
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which two people, groups, or countries give each other similar kinds of help or special rights

name: reclaim
trans: vt. 要求收回; 开拓；开垦; 从废料中回收; 纠正；教化，改造 时 态: reclaimed，reclaiming，reclaims 形容词: reclaimable

sentences.english: You may be entitled to reclaim some tax.
sentences.chinese: 你也许可以享受一定额度的退税。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开拓；回收再利用；改造某人，使某人悔改
detailed_translations.english: to get back an amount of money that you have paid

name: recourse
trans: n. 追索权；依赖；救生索；求援，求助

sentences.english: We may conclude that he never had recourse to this simple experiment.
sentences.chinese: 我们也许可以断定，他根本就没有试过这个简单的实验。

sentences.english: Surgery may be the only recourse.
sentences.chinese: 手术可能是唯一的办法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 求援，求助；[经] 追索权；依赖；救生索
detailed_translations.english: something that you do to achieve something or deal with a situation, or the act of doing it

name: rectify
trans: vt. 改正；整流；精馏 时 态: rectified, rectifying, rectifies 形容词: rectifiable 名 词: rectificat...

sentences.english: I did my best to rectify the situation, but the damage was already done.
sentences.chinese: 我竭尽全力去挽回局面，但损害已经造成了。

detailed_translations.english: to correct something that is wrong

name: recur
trans: vi. 重现；复发；再来；采用；循环；递归 时 态: recurred, recurring, recurs 名 词: recurrence

sentences.english: There is a danger that the disease may recur.
sentences.chinese: 这种病有复发的危险。

sentences.english: Love is a recurring theme in the book.
sentences.chinese: 爱情是这本书中反复出现的主题。

detailed_translations.chinese: (尤指不好的事)一再发生；重现
detailed_translations.english: if something, especially something bad or unpleasant, recurs, it happens again

name: referendum
trans: n. 公民投票权；外交官请示书

sentences.english: The city council agreed to hold a referendum on the issue in November.
sentences.chinese: 市政会同意在11月就此问题进行全民投票。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公民投票权；外交官请示书
detailed_translations.english: when people vote in order to make a decision about a particular subject, rather than voting for a person

name: refrain
trans: vi. 制止；避免；节制，克制; n. 叠句，副歌；重复 时 态: refrained, refraining, refrains

sentences.english: Mrs. Hardie refrained from making any comment.
sentences.chinese: 哈迪太太忍住了没做任何评论。

detailed_translations.english: to not do something that you want to do
part of a song or poem that is repeated, especially at the end of each  verse

name: regime
trans: n. 政权，政体；社会制度；管理体制

sentences.english: The regime got rid of most of its opponents.
sentences.chinese: 该政权清除了大多数反对者。

sentences.english: Under the new regime, all sheep and cattle will be regularly tested for disease.
sentences.chinese: 根据新制度，所有牛羊都要定期接受疾病检测。

detailed_translations.english: a government, especially one that was not elected fairly or that you disapprove of for some other reason

name: rekindle
trans: vt. 使再燃时 态: rekindled, rekindling, rekindles

sentences.english: The trial has rekindled painful memories of the war.
sentences.chinese: 这场审判又唤起了人们对战争的痛苦回忆。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone have a particular feeling, thought etc again

name: relish
trans: n. 滋味；风味；食欲；开胃小菜；含义; vt. 喜爱；品味；给…加佐料; vi. 有特定意味；味道可口 时 态: relished, relishing, relishes

sentences.english: I relish the challenge of doing jobs that others turn down.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢接受挑战做别人拒绝做的工作。

sentences.english: The three men ate with relish.
sentences.chinese: 那3个人吃得津津有味。

detailed_translations.english: to enjoy an experience or the thought of something that is going to happen
Relish is also a noun

name: repatriate
trans: vt. 把遣送回国, 遣返时 态: repatriated, repatriating, repatriates 名 词: repatriation

sentences.english: After the war, prisoners were repatriated.
sentences.chinese: 战后，战俘被遣返。

detailed_translations.english: to send someone back to their own country

name: repository
trans: n. 仓库，贮藏室，存放处; 智囊，知识渊博的人，知识宝典

detailed_translations.chinese: 贮藏室，仓库；知识库；智囊团
detailed_translations.english: a place or container in which large quantities of something are stored

name: reputable
trans: adj. 值得尊敬的;声誉好的; adv. 声誉好地 副 词: reputably

sentences.english: You are well advised to buy your car through a reputable dealer.
sentences.chinese: 你通过一个声誉好的经销商来买车是明智的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声誉好的；受尊敬的；卓越的
detailed_translations.english: respected for being honest or for doing good work

name: resilience
trans: n. 弹回;弹性; 恢复力；适应力

sentences.english: And I think what we're seeing in the economy now is the inherent resilience of the American economy and the American people.
sentences.chinese: 而且我认为，我认为，在经济方面，我们现在看到的是美国经济和美国人民一直以来所固有的弹性。

detailed_translations.english: the ability of a substance such as rubber to return to its original shape after it has been pressed or bent

name: reticence
trans: n. 沉默寡言

name: revolve
trans: vt. & vi. 旋转; 细想 时 态: revolved, revolving, revolves 形容词: revolvable

sentences.english: The wheel began to revolve.
sentences.chinese: 轮子开始旋转。

sentences.english: The restaurant slowly revolves, giving excellent views of the city.
sentences.chinese: 餐厅缓缓旋转，城市美景尽收眼底。

sentences.english: Using graphics software, you can revolve the image on the screen.
sentences.chinese: 使用绘图软件可以旋转屏幕上的图像。

detailed_translations.chinese: 旋转；循环出现；反复考虑
detailed_translations.english: to move around like a wheel, or to make something move around like a wheel

name: rift
trans: n. 裂缝, 裂隙; 分裂, 不和 时 态: rifted, rifting, rifts

sentences.english: The interview reflected a growing rift between the president and Congress.
sentences.chinese: 这次会见反映出总统与国会间日益加深的不和。

detailed_translations.english: a crack or narrow opening in a large mass of rock, cloud etc

name: rig
trans: n. 船桅的装置; 成套器械; vt. 给装配帆及索具; 用临时替代材料迅速搭起; 操纵, 垄断 时 态: rigged, rigging, rigs

sentences.english: The ship was fully rigged and ready to sail.
sentences.chinese: 船已装备就绪，等待起航。

detailed_translations.chinese: 给船装帆;为提供必要装备
detailed_translations.english: to put ropes, sails etc on a ship

name: rigid
trans: adj. 严格的；僵硬的，死板的；坚硬的；精确的 副 词: rigidly 名 词: rigidness

sentences.english: rigid plastic
sentences.chinese: 硬塑料

detailed_translations.english: stiff and not moving or bending

name: rumour
trans: n. 谣言; vt. 传闻

sentences.english: His name has come up in the rumour mill as a possible director for the project.
sentences.chinese: 有谣传说他可能出任这个项目的主管。

detailed_translations.english: information or a story that is passed from one person to another and which may or may not be true

name: sabbatical
trans: adj. 休假的;公休的; n. 学术休假

sentences.english: She took a long sabbatical .
sentences.chinese: 她休了个长假。

detailed_translations.chinese: 休假（美国某些大学给大学教师每七年一次的）
detailed_translations.english: a period when someone, especially someone in a university job, stops doing their usual work in order to study or travel

name: sack
trans: n. 麻袋, 包; 一袋的量; 开除, 解雇; 洗劫, 劫掠; vt. 装入袋中; 解雇; 洗劫, 劫掠 时 态: sacked, sacking, sacks

sentences.english: They’ve never actually given anyone the sack .
sentences.chinese: 他们从未真的辞退过什么人。

sentences.english: He got the sack for stealing.
sentences.chinese: 他因偷东西而被解雇。

sentences.english: She claimed she’d been threatened with the sack.
sentences.chinese: 她称自己受到过解雇的威胁。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is dismissed from their job
to dismiss someone from their job

name: salient
trans: adj. 显著的,重要的,主要的; 凸出的; n. 凸角; 进攻或防卫阵地的突出部分

sentences.english: the salient points of the report
sentences.chinese: 这份报告的要点

detailed_translations.english: the salient points or features of something are the most important or most noticeable parts of it

name: salon
trans: n. 〈法〉店, 厅, 院; 沙龙

sentences.english: a literary salon
sentences.chinese: 文学沙龙

detailed_translations.chinese: 沙龙；客厅；画廊；美术展览馆
detailed_translations.english: a room in a very large house, where people can meet and talk

name: sampling
trans: n. 抽样；取样; v. 取样；抽样

name: sanitary
trans: adj. 卫生的，清洁的; n. 公共厕所 副 词: sanitarily

sentences.english: Diseases were spread through poor sanitary conditions .
