trans: adj. 无障碍的; 无阻挡的

name: unleash
trans: vt. 把释放出来, 发泄时 态: unleashed, unleashing, unleashes

sentences.english: Lefèvre’s comments unleashed a wave of protest.
sentences.chinese: 勒菲弗的评论引发了一波抗议的浪潮。

detailed_translations.english: to suddenly let a strong force, feeling etc have its full effect

name: unprejudiced
trans: adj. 无偏见的, 无成见的, 公正的

sentences.english: Narrator: This is a tale about an unprejudiced heart, and how it changed our valley forever.
sentences.chinese: 叙述者：故事讲述的是一颗毫无偏见的心是怎样改变我们这个山谷的。

detailed_translations.english: not prejudiced or biased; impartial

name: unrivalled
trans: adj. 无敌的,无对手的,无双的,无比的

name: unscathed
trans: adj. 未受损伤的,未受伤害的

sentences.english: The government was relatively unscathed by the scandal.
sentences.chinese: 政府基本上没有受到这桩丑闻的影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 未受损伤的， 未受伤害的
detailed_translations.english: not injured or harmed by something

name: unsolicited
trans: adj. 未被恳求的,主动提供的

name: unswerving
trans: adj. 坚持不懈的,坚定不移的; 不歪的,不偏离的; adv. 坚持不懈地,坚定不移地

sentences.english: ...her unswerving belief in her father's innocence.
sentences.chinese: ...她坚定地相信她父亲是清白的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 坚定的；始终不渝的；不歪的
detailed_translations.english: an unswerving belief or attitude is one that is very strong and never changes

name: unveil
trans: vt. 揭去…的面罩，除去…的遮盖物; 使公之于众；揭露; vi. 除去面纱；揭幕; 揭露出来 时 态: unveiled，unveiling，unveils

sentences.english: The statue was unveiled by the Queen.
sentences.chinese: 这尊雕塑由女王揭幕。

detailed_translations.english: to remove the cover from something, especially as part of a formal ceremony

name: upright
trans: adj. 正直的，诚实的；垂直的，直立的；笔直的；合乎正道的; n. 竖立；垂直 副 词: uprightly 名 词: uprightness

sentences.english: Katie was still awake, sitting bolt upright(= sitting with her back very straight ) staring at the television.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂还醒着，坐得笔直，眼睛盯着电视。

detailed_translations.chinese: 正直的，诚实的；垂直的，直立的；笔直的；合乎正道的
detailed_translations.english: standing or sitting straight up
a long piece of wood or metal that stands straight up and supports something

name: urgency
trans: n. 紧迫;急迫;急事；紧要; 催促;坚持

sentences.english: In case of urgency, call the police.
sentences.chinese: 一旦发生紧急情况，打电话给警察。

sentences.english: I appreciate the sense of urgency because I feel it myself.
sentences.chinese: 我欣赏这种紧迫的感觉因为我自己就能体会到。

sentences.english: However pressing the need and urgency of the problem one should not proceed without a plausible plan.
sentences.chinese: 无论需要多么紧迫，问题多么紧急，一个人不能没有看似有理的计划就开始行动。

name: vaccine
trans: n. 疫苗;痘苗; adj. 痘苗的;疫苗的

sentences.english: a polio vaccine
sentences.chinese: 小儿麻痹症疫苗

sentences.english: Doctors worried that there would not be enough vaccine for everyone who needed it.
sentences.chinese: 医生担心没有足够的疫苗给每个需要的人。

detailed_translations.english: a substance which contains a weak form of the bacteria or virus that causes a disease and is used to protect people from that disease

name: van
trans: n. 先锋；厢式货车；增值网; vt. 用车搬运 Van范时 态: vanned, vanning, vans

sentences.english: a delivery van
sentences.chinese: 运货车

sentences.english: a van driver
sentences.chinese: 小型货车司机

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle used especially for carrying goods, which is smaller than a truck and has a roof and usually no windows at the sides

name: vandalism
trans: n. 肆意破坏公物等德行；汪达尔人作风 Vandalism汪达尔人的行为或作风

sentences.english: ...a 13-year-old boy whose crime file includes violence, theft, vandalism and bullying.
sentences.chinese: …一个犯罪档案中包括暴力、偷窃、破坏公物和恃强凌弱的13岁男孩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 汪达尔人作风；故意毁坏文物的行为；破坏他人财产的行为
detailed_translations.english: the crime of deliberately damaging things, especially public property

name: variability
trans: n. 变化性;易变;变化的倾向

sentences.english: In our world, not only do we have variability, we've got unpredictability.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的世界不仅有可变性，还有不可预见性。

sentences.english: There are many problems with rankings, especially the metrics used and the variability.
sentences.chinese: 排名有很多问题，特别是排名所依据的指标和排名的可变性。

sentences.english: Abstract: : housing demand and housing adaptability, variability is not coordination problem of current our country city housing is very serious.
sentences.chinese: 摘要： 当前我国城市住宅中居住需求与住宅适应性、可变性不相协调的问题十分突出。

name: vend
trans: vt. 出售; 贩卖，叫卖; 发表；声明 时 态: vended，vending，vends

name: vent
trans: n. 出口；通风孔；发泄; vt. 发泄感情；放出…；给…开孔; vi. 减轻压力；放出 时 态: vented, venting, vents 名 词: venter

sentences.english: a blocked air vent
sentences.chinese: 堵塞的通风口

sentences.english: a volcanic vent
sentences.chinese: 火山口

detailed_translations.english: a hole or pipe through which gases, liquid etc can enter or escape from an enclosed space or container
to express feelings of anger, hatred etc, especially by doing something violent or harmful

name: veracity
trans: n. 诚实;真实

sentences.english: We have total confidence in the veracity of our research.
sentences.chinese: 对我们研究的真实性，我们有绝对的信心。

detailed_translations.chinese: 诚实；精确性；老实；说真实话
detailed_translations.english: the fact of being true or correct

name: veranda
trans: n. 阳台；走廊，游廊

sentences.english: They had their coffee and tea on the veranda.
sentences.chinese: 他们在阳台上享用了自己的咖啡和茶。

detailed_translations.english: an open area with a floor and a roof that is attached to the side of a house at ground level

name: versatile
trans: adj. 有多种学问、技能或职业的；多才多艺的; 多用途的，多功能的 副 词: versatilely 名 词: versatility

sentences.english: The potato is an extremely versatile vegetable.
sentences.chinese: 马铃薯是一种用途极广的蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: having many different uses

name: vested
trans: adj. 既定的；穿着衣服的；带背心的; v. 使穿衣服；授予

sentences.english: Shareholders have a vested right to 10% per annum.
sentences.chinese: 股东享有每年10%分红的既定权利。

detailed_translations.chinese: 法律规定的； 既定的
detailed_translations.english: vested rights, powers, property etc belong to you and cannot be removed

name: veteran
trans: n. 经验丰富的人; 老兵; 退伍军人

sentences.english: He is a veteran of the last revolution in medical technology, gene therapy, which, after some hyped expectations in the 1990s, fell into disfavor after some unsuccessful trials.
sentences.chinese: 他是基因治疗这项最新医学技术的老手，经过了1990年代的兴奋期和之后几次失败的实验后，基因治疗技术已经失宠了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been a soldier, sailor etc in a war

name: vicissitude
trans: n. 变迁兴衰

sentences.english: It reflects the vicissitude of society.
sentences.chinese: 它反映了社会的变迁兴衰。

sentences.english: So great a vicissitude in his life could not at once be received as real.
sentences.chinese: 他的生活中发生了如此巨大的变迁，他一时还无法相信是真的。

sentences.english: This kind of boundary is relative, only has the temporary stability and the validity, it along with situation change, but unceasing vicissitude.
sentences.chinese: 这种边界是相对的，仅具有暂时的稳定性和有效性，它随着情境的变化而不断变迁。

name: victimise
trans: vt. 责怪或处罚某人不当; 不正当地使某人受损害或受苦难;欺负某人

name: villa
trans: n. 别墅；郊区住宅

sentences.english: We rented a holiday villa in Spain.
sentences.chinese: 我们在西班牙租了一座假日别墅。

detailed_translations.english: a house that you use or rent while you are on holiday

name: virgin
trans: adj. 处女的；纯洁的；未经利用的，处于原始状态的; n. 处女

sentences.english: I was a virgin until I was thirty years old.
sentences.chinese: 我到30岁时还是个处女。

sentences.english: a virgin bride
sentences.chinese: 贞洁的新娘

detailed_translations.english: someone who has never had sex
without sexual experience

name: vitality
trans: n. 活力，生气；生命力，生动性

sentences.english: Despite her eighty years, Elsie was full of vitality.
sentences.chinese: 尽管已80岁了，埃尔茜依然充满活力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 活力； 生机， 元气
detailed_translations.english: great energy and eagerness to do things

name: vow
trans: n. 誓言; 郑重宣布；许愿; vt. & vi. 起誓，发誓; 郑重宣告 时 态: vowed，vowing，vows 名 词: vower

sentences.english: Jim made a vow that he would find his wife’s killer.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆发誓要找到杀害他妻子的凶手。

sentences.english: While many models vow to go back to college, few do.
sentences.chinese: 很多模特儿发誓要重返大学，但几乎无人做到。

sentences.english: I solemnly vowed that someday I would return to live in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 我郑重起誓总有一天我要重回欧洲生活。

detailed_translations.english: a serious promise
If you vow to do something, you make a serious promise or decision that you will do it

name: wade
trans: vt. & vi. 蹚, 走过, 跋时 态: waded, wading, wades

sentences.english: He waded into the water to push the boat out.
sentences.chinese: 他蹚进水里把船推出来。

sentences.english: Sometimes they had to wade waist-deep through mud.
sentences.chinese: 有时他们得通过齐腰深的泥浆。

detailed_translations.english: to walk through water that is not deep

name: waist
trans: n. 腰，腰部

sentences.english: The skirt was too big around the waist.
sentences.chinese: 那条裙子腰围太大。

detailed_translations.english: the narrow part in the middle of the human body

name: wardrobe
trans: n. 衣柜；全部戏装；行头

sentences.english: Can you hang these in the wardrobe, please?
sentences.chinese: 请你把这些衣服挂到衣橱里去好吗？

sentences.english: fitted/built-in wardrobes (=wardrobes built against a wall or fitted between two walls)
sentences.chinese: 固定式/嵌入式衣柜

detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture like a large cupboard that you hang clothes in

name: wary
trans: adj. 机警的；谨慎的；惟恐的；考虑周到的 比较级: warier, wariest 副 词: warily 名 词: wariness

sentences.english: Keep a wary eye on the weather before you set sail.
sentences.chinese: 出航前要密切注意天气。

sentences.english: She had a wary expression on her face.
sentences.chinese: 她脸上带着小心谨慎的表情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谨慎的；机警的；惟恐的；考虑周到的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is wary is careful because they think something might be dangerous or harmful

name: watertight
trans: adj. 不漏水的,水密的

sentences.english: a watertight container
sentences.chinese: 不漏水的容器

detailed_translations.english: that does not allow water to get in or out

name: wean
trans: vt. 使断奶；使断念；使放弃; n. 幼儿 时 态: weaned, weaning, weans

sentences.english: When would be the best time to start weaning my baby?
sentences.chinese: 什么时候开始给我的孩子断奶最好呢？

detailed_translations.english: to gradually stop feeding a baby or young animal on its mother’s milk and start giving it ordinary food

name: wedge
trans: vt. 楔入；挤进；楔住; vi. 楔入；挤进; n. 楔子；楔形物；导致分裂的东西 时 态: wedged, wedging, wedges

sentences.english: He hammered the wedge into the crack in the stone.
sentences.chinese: 他用锤子把楔子砸入石缝里。

sentences.english: The phone was wedged under his chin.
sentences.chinese: 电话夹在他下巴下面。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of wood, metal etc that has one thick edge and one pointed edge and is used especially for keeping a door open or for splitting wood
to force something firmly into a narrow space

name: weld
trans: vt. 焊接；使结合；使成整体; vi. 焊牢; n. 焊接；焊接点 时 态: welded, welding, welds

sentences.english: The new handle will have to be welded on.
sentences.chinese: 新的把手得焊上去。

detailed_translations.english: to join metals by melting their edges and pressing them together when they are hot
a joint that is made by welding two pieces of metal together

name: whim
trans: n. 一时的兴致, 突然的念头, 突发奇想, 异想天开

sentences.english: On arrival, she buys a glass factory on a whim, and challenges him to transport a church built entirely of glass by boat from Sydney 250 miles up the coast.
sentences.chinese: 到达目的地后，她突发奇想买了一个玻璃厂，并向他挑战，让他用船沿着 250 英里长的海岸线从悉尼运来建造一整座玻璃教堂。

sentences.english: An idle whim, I fear, sir,' was my answer; `or else an idle whim is going to spirit me away.
sentences.chinese: “恐怕是一种无聊的奇想，先生，”这是我的回答，“不然就是一种无聊的奇想又要诱使我走开。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden feeling that you would like to do or have something, especially when there is no important or good reason

name: wilderness
trans: n. 荒野;沙漠; 在野；不再当政

sentences.english: ...the icy Canadian wilderness.
sentences.chinese: …冰封的加拿大荒野。

detailed_translations.english: A wilderness is a desert or other area of natural land which is not used by people

name: worship
trans: vt. 崇拜；尊崇; vi. 做礼拜 时 态: worshiped ，worshipped worshiping ，worshipping worships ，worships

sentences.english: The ceremony must take place in a recognized place of worship.
sentences.chinese: 该仪式必须在获得认可的敬拜场所举行。

sentences.english: He absolutely worships her.
sentences.chinese: 他太崇拜她了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 礼拜；崇拜；崇拜: 爱慕：崇敬
detailed_translations.english: the activity of praying or singing in a religious building in order to show respect and love for a god
to admire and love someone very much

name: wring
trans: vt. 绞，拧，扭; 握紧; 把拧干；绞掉 时 态: wrung wringing，wrings

sentences.english: This jacket’s wringing wet!
sentences.chinese: 这件上衣湿得都能拧出水来！

detailed_translations.english: to tightly twist a wet cloth or wet clothes in order to remove water

name: writhe
trans: vi. 蠕动；翻滚; vt. 扭曲；扭动; n. 扭动；苦恼；翻滚 时 态: writhed, writhing, writhes

sentences.english: His family could only cry and watch this expert marksman twist and writhe in his death agonies.
sentences.chinese: 他的家人只能嚎啕大哭，眼睁睁地看着这个出色的神枪手在扭曲翻滚中痛苦地死去。

name: zipper
trans: n. 拉链; vi. 拉上拉链; vt. 用拉链扣上

sentences.english: ...the metal zipper on his jacket.
sentences.chinese: …他的夹克上的金属拉锁。

detailed_translations.english: two lines of small metal or plastic pieces that slide together to fasten a piece of clothing
